item.title: The Rules of Inference
item.description: Simple binary operators aren’t a structure powerful enough to define rules of reasoning. This is where rules of inference come into play. They are forms of reasoning that we can prove to be correct. Let’s discover a few of them.

item.title: Boolean Algebra
item.description: Binary operators are simple. Nevertheless some non-trivial rules can be applied to them to make appear some other forms of an identical expression which allows us, for example, to make simplifications.

item.title: "Complex" Boolean Operators
item.description: The boolean operators negation, AND and OR suffice to represent all expressions. However, it might some time be easier to define a few more operators for the sake of simplicity. In this article, I will cover the if then and equivalence operators.

item.title: An Introduction to Boolean Logic
item.description: A strong and correct reasoning must, at the very least, be rooted in a rock solid logic. This article tries to explain the basics of the boolean logic, one of the most commonly used logic in mathematics.
